description:
Seven months since my last visit and I decided to update my review, changing from 3 stars to 4.  I got the Panang Curry Nuer (beef) and it was....wonderful!  Just like I remembered it from years back -- maybe even better.  Just the right flavor, spice, and even a perfect hint of mint.  Love the beef stew cubes, which don't contain a bit of fat.  Love that they use eggplant, an excellent complement.  They also use green bell pepper, but I'm not a fan of that so I asked them to leave that out.  It is hard to find my very favorite Thai curry that also uses stew beef chunks, Massaman, anywhere in the city, or at least made well (including here, because they have a permanent special, Massaman chicken, which I'm not a fan of), so the Panang here is definitely a great substitution.  The dish was truly satisfying.

Unfortunately, still staying away from the items I didn't care much for in my very first review from 2014, I will definitely come back for my other two faves from last review, the Pad Himmaparn and Praram.

With these years passing, the old crew of servers have long gone.  The new fellows are nice, if not as personable.  Place was pretty empty for dinner but I'm sure has more people for lunch or when a convention is in town.
author: Merrick W.

description:
Nice, traditional Thai restaurant near Moscone. While the restaurant looks a little tired, the food is delicious... especially with some extra chili sauce (sambal).
I prefer these mom and pop Thai places over the ultra-trendy ones.
author: Ajay P.

description:
The not-as-crowded Thai place across the street from OSHA. Had a nice meal here and it was pretty convenient and tasty. Could help but get the fried chicken over fried rice. Scrumptious. Chicken was crispy and pretty tender. The rice was perfectly seasoned and came with a few veges on the side. 

The venue has a full bar and is clean inside. Staff is nice. Good lunch spot.
author: Young Y.

description:
I recently had lunch at Cha-Am w/ some friends on a Friday afternoon.
They are located in SoMa. There was half a dozen vegetarian items on the lunch special & 9 vegetarian items on the regular menu that served the needs of this vegan.

We ordered family style sharing for an appetizer both the Golden Triangles & the Crispy Tofu. The Golden Triangles were stuffed w/ Thai yellow squash, potatoes, fresh corn, red yams, & Thai herbs served w/ a sweet & sour sauce. The Crispy Tofu was deep fried tofu served also w/ a sweet & sour sauce. 

I loved the Golden Triangles as were flavorful filled w/ an assortment of the above mentioned veggies. I would recommend them as an appetizer to share & the Crispy Tofu was quite alright.

For my entree I ordered off the regular menu the Pad-Hed-Ruam-Mit  Vegetarian which included Sautéed fresh mushrooms, shiitake mushrooms, oyster mushrooms, deep-fried tofu, yellow onions, green onions, & vegetables with garlic & Thai herb sauce. I had this w/ a side order of brown rice.

I requested some hot sauces on the side. I loved the visual aesthetic of the containers the hot sauces were stored in as they were unique vases as opposed to typical metal containers that most Thai restaurants have.

My entree was enjoyable as felt the unique mushrooms really made the dish. The dish wasn't particularly spicy as the flavor came mainly from the mushrooms. I did add some of the assortment of hot sauces to kick up the heat a bit. 

One of my friends ordered the same entree I did & enjoyed it while my other friend ordered a vegan version of the Pad Thai coming w/ rice noodles with tofu, bean sprout, roasted ground peanuts and lime juice. I tried his Pad Thai & was quite alright.

Service was attentive. Our timing was perfect as just as we were leaving a business party of nearly 30 people showed up. They were enjoying the amenities of the full bar & preparing to sit down as the server joined countless tables together to prepare for the coming group. 

As it was a Friday afternoon they were kicking their weekend off as they were a bit loud getting ready for a festive lunch to kick off their weekend.

I look forward to returning here for lunch & will look to try one of the curries next time.
author: Shane S.

description:
I never write reviews. I work in the hospitality industry so I can understand that sometimes, hotels, restaurants have bad days. Whether its due to being short staffed or being overly busy. I get it, because I've lived it and even poor experiences I try not to take to heart. But this place took the cake. I arrived to a very dead restaurant so hey that's fine maybe I won't have to wait so long. 4 tables being used in the entire restaurant with mine being one of them. Ordered an entree and a beer. Took over 20 mins to get the entire, but whatever its fine, maybe the kitchen is backed up. I start to notice that the tables they are being attentive to happen to have people in suits. I was not dressed in a suit, I wear one all day so I wanted to be super comfy and causal. I felt as if I was being treated like a second class citizen because of it. Entree finally comes but no beer, cool no worried maybe they forgot or the server didn't hear me. 5 minutes later flag them down and asked for the beer, beer comes I finish my entree and then the check comes. I wasn't done with my beer, I actually wanted another. I was even going to ask for dessert but bringing me the check this like this, means you want me to leave. OK fine, I'll go and never go back. No one checked in, no one bother to ask about anything. I leave incredibly upset. So please don't go here. Oh unless you're dressed in a suit and coming from the Moscone center....

This is the first time I've ever written any sort of review, so this should tell you the level of how upset this place made me.
author: Marco T.

description:
Food Highlight: get the COCONUT JUICE, period.
My Colleagues brought me here for lunch. I believe they are serving normal Thai style dishes, but they offer better than average quality. One thing that surprised me is their Coconut Juice. I have always been a fan of coconut. It has been a while since I tasted a good coconut. Here they offer fresh coconut, and they will open it for you to drink the juice, without adding any sugar/sweetener, just iced it. I found it's extremely delicious and also especially helpful when you are eating kind of greasy food.
author: Yanzhong L.

description:
When I was working across the street, I would rely on this place for lunch and for my Thai food cravings! Service can be slow...but what do you expect when it's peak lunch hours I guess! 

I've had the tom kha soup, papaya salad, seafood salad, basil chicken, and pad thai. Nothing has disappointed me. My sister and I love the seafood salad and crave it all the time.

This isn't the place to get lunch when you're in a jiffy, but the prices are way better than OSHA across the street so I don't mind coming here at all!
author: Jessica Y.

description: Fast service, friendly staff, great food. Across the street from the convention center. Will come again when next in town.
author: David S.

description:
I spent a couple years in SOMA, and I'll be honest that I don't have a ton of amazing food memories. There are some really good food places there, but a lot of them then - and even more of them now - are high-priced new-American joints that are great for date night but just not my jam, nor a good option for a bachelor on a schedule to get a solid dinner. That's the other undoing of this neighborhood - a surprising number of places close earlyish, especially as you get north closer to FiDi. 

Cha-Am is a wonderful exception to that. At the time, a younger, less-experienced me would call it the best thai food I've had. Now, I know that the truly delicious Thai is in the TL and out west, but Cha-Am surely fits the bill and definitely beats anywhere nearby. It's also one of the cheapest dinners in SOMA. 

Last time I was there, I had their red curry with flank steak (Pa-neang-neua) and OMG was it delicious. May've found a new addiction. Their Pad Thai is solid too, if not write-home-level. Will for sure be back when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Chris S.

description:
Pretty decent place for Thai food in downtown. Open later than most places of this kind.
Food was prepared fairly fast and appeared without delays and tasted authentic! Good and attentive service event late at night.
author: Andy M.

description:
Not the best Thai restaurant in downtown SF, and not the cheapest either. Having Osha right in front and Lao Table right around the corner, the slot for $$-$$$ Thai restaurants is covered, so you would expect Cha-Am to fill the $ gap. However, it's almost as expensive as the other two, and nowhere near as good as them.

Their Pad See Ew is not bad, but the meat is not the best. Last time we were there we were a big group and had a significant waiting time for some of the entrees.
author: Antonio H.

description: My family and I went to this restaurant, the food there was delicious. The prices were a little high though. Unlike the restaurant across the street, it wasn't busy. I would probably have lunch here again.
author: Katherine E.

description:
A long time Thai restaurant that now faces more competition from the newer, trendier, and slightly hipper Osha Thai across the street. 

Cha-Am's strengths are the validated parking, the lack of wait times and a solid selection of Thai popular dishes. 

I ordered the Tom yum most recently and got a large size for $11.50.  I couldn't help but be disappointed by the watery and overly sweet broth combined with largely cut mushrooms and a handful of shrimp and lemongrass.  Not spicy or flavorful at all. 

I understand the duck fried rice is good here so perhaps will try that next time. 

Cha Am accepts credit cards including Amex.
author: Randy F.

description:
In a sea of Thai places in San Fran one can get lost. But this joint, has it's perks and works if you are in need a decent lunch! 
I had Thai food 3 days in a row on my last trip to San Fran, this being my last meal! 
I choose the Yellow Curry with Tofu, since Im vegan. 
It's less spicy then other Yellow Curry's I have had in the city but also really flavorful, so your still getting what you want, just without the kick.... But they brought out a nice array of spices, so you can give it that kick if you want! 
The presentation was nice, but I was also jealous of the presentation of my coworker's meal he had ordered.. 

The place is pretty open, and at 11am was not to busy! (there is a thai place also across the street... a more white table cloth, hostess vibe...) 
But this place staff was great, food came fast, and it was great!
The bathroom is a little bit of a pain to get too but, it was good to walk off a little of my meal! 
All in all, I would go back, any time!
author: Patrick T.

description:
I did enjoy the food, but the trip to the bathroom was rather epic. It really wasn't a big deal, but I do enjoy an adventure to the loo every now and then. 

I suppose I'm putting on my snobby pants on this one, but I can only judge the eats via experience, and Cha-Am simply delivered what I was looking for, solid Thai food at a fair price, annnd... scene. And hey, I'm basing this on lunch with water, that's it. But the pumpkin curry with shrimp was kinda exactly what I expected from a neighborhood spot in my hometown. Which may speak volumes about Albuquerque's Thai scene, but I doubt it. 

The place was rather desolate when we entered around noon. Service was a tad spotty, especially regarding the check delivery: paying the bill required hunting down the server. #FirstWorldProblems, I know, but kind of inexcusable. But I did enjoy the meal, slurped up every drop, and the prices were fair. I'm guessing they're a little hesitant to take chances on the food with the hotel clientele nearby. The tourists. My vote, guys: I'm a tourist, I'd love some adventure on the menu. The bathroom wasn't the adventure I'd planned to take.
author: Howie K.

description:
Not to be mean, but in a way, it feels like time (and SF) is starting to pass Cha-Am by.  The look of the restaurant is definitely more modern than some of the neighborhood spots in the Sunset and Richmond, but the vibe of the place feels like it's stuck in the late 90's/early 00's.  Especially with the 15 year old news articles and plaques on their walls and, despite having been around for so long, the surprisingly low number of reviews on Yelp.  If nothing else, I'm clearly on discovering Cha-Am!

Walking in, it wasn't a shock to see that the restaurant was mostly empty.  For one, the ever popular Osha Thai has a location right across the street (which is usually busy).  Secondly, and perhaps more significantly, the menu (and the food) isn't particularly exciting.  Not bad, but not exciting.  Outside of what I assume is their specialties board, as well as a handful of entrees, the majority of the menu is made of your usual mix of starters, noodles, fried rice, curries, and entrees.

-- CHICKEN WINGS - Deep Fried Chicken Wings Sauteed with Pepper Garlic Sauce and served with a Sweet & Sour Sauce...$7.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cha-am-san-francisco?select=KNP3AZrUFXI6EDNm1c6Emg)
Easily the best thing we had.  They're kind of like Angel Wings, but slightly different.  The wings were slightly crispy, yet juicy through and through, but the pepper garlic sauce was what really stood out.  The mix of flavors was so good, I didn't even use the sweet & sour sauce!  That said, I could've used less of the garnishments and carrots there were thrown in.

-- MASSAMAN CHICKEN - Housemade Massaman Curry with Chicken, Tomato, Onion, Peanut, Potato, Bell Pepper, and Coconut Milk...$15.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cha-am-san-francisco?select=rNfNVXrZgMDLNcaKu2QMKw)
I was the most hopeful for this one (it's on their "specials board"), but it disappointed.  The chicken and veggies were more or less fine, though I wasn't a fan of the tomatoes.  However, the curry was more runny than creamy/rich and the taste of it wasn't that dynamic or intense, except for a lot of star anise, which I kept biting into.

-- PINEAPPLE FRIED RICE with Pineapple, Cashew Nuts, Eggs, Onion, Garlic, and Thai Herbs with Choice of CHICKEN, Pork, Beef, or Prawns (+$1.00)...$12.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cha-am-san-francisco?select=SP-2qhW96-mdzlpKj89cvw)
Really meh, to be honest.  While I appreciated all of the different components, there was a little too much going on.  Peas, carrots, cashews...everything just kind of muddled each other up and felt more like a stir-fried dish with rice than fried rice.  That said, I did like the acidity and sweetness that the pineapples added.

-- PAD THAI - Stir-fried Sticky Rice Noodles with Tofu, Egg, Bean Sprouts, Roasted Ground Peanuts, and Lime Juice Palm Sugar Sauce with choice of PORK, Chicken, Beef, Veggie & Tofu, or Shrimp (+$1.00)...$10.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cha-am-san-francisco?select=H67ShmpFV09N6XiB91RBRQ)
While I'm not sure pork was the best option, the rest of the dish was more or less okay.  The portion was a little small (lots of sprouts), but the rest of the flavors were pretty standard.  The sauce had a nice mix of sweet and acidic flavors and I liked how the noodles weren't super gummy.  

Although the food may not amaze, given how quiet this place was on a Saturday night (only two people walked in after us to pick up take out orders), Cha Am might be a decent pick for something quick, hassle free, and relatively cheap (for the area).  Otherwise, for something tastier, there's no question the likes of Kin Khao, Lers Ros, Thai Tycoon, and Osha Thai are better bets.
author: Mike L.

description:
EAT HERE WITH CAUTION!!

This is our second time having take out from this place. First time was not bad, which is why we ordered again. However this time we ordered I found a marble in my pineapple fried rice!!  

Did not notice it until I took a bite of my food and realized I was not eating rice. Definitely NOT okay. Tried contacting the restaurant to let them know but no one answered. Incredibly unsafe & disgusting.
author: Tiffany O.

description: Out of all the Thai places around, this is the worst. First of all, the prices are just as expensive as OSHA Thai but the ambiance and the service is lackluster. We went on a Sunday evening and it was not crowded at all - 3 tables total including myself and my family. There were 2 servers and one decided to just hang out by the bar area station and look at his phone. We asked for another table setting for my daughter and never got it. So I decided to get a table napkin and spoon from another table (the sever saw me but didn't get the hint). Then it took about 20 min to get our order and wondered why it took so long for one of the 2 servers to come by. When we finally ordered and got our food, it was terrible. The papaya salad we ordered was too citrusy - they totally poured lemon juice all over it that overpowered the taste - seemed like they were masking for a missing ingredient. The pad-sew-ew we ordered had soggy noodles and included cabbage (strange)?  The Thai fried rice had cauliflower and other vegetables (tasted like it came out of a frozen bag of vegetables). We didn't finish the food and didn't take it to go. And at least have better tentative service. Not worth it for all the other places you can check out for Thai food.
author: Cliff H.

description:
I love coming here to visit my friends. 
Tania makes the best drinks. 
The chef know what you want. I tried the spicy raw shrimps here and being the Korean I am, I thought I could handle spicy.. but the dish made me think twice. It really woke me up! The dish is very addicting, but make sure you don't eat too much of it. 

Their curry dishes are delicious and don't forget to try their fried calamari!
Also, the iced coffee is recommended!
author: Christina L.

description:
My experience for dinner at 7:30 PM on a Friday was as follows:
-- Food was ok
-- The restaurant to me looks to be deteriorating in terms of maintenance. The upholstered back to the seating area is torn in places and has been covered in duck tape. The tables, which I once remember to have tablecloths, have been replaces with red formica.
-- The service was miserable, in spite of the fact that we were one of three tables in the restaurant.
author: Jeff J.

description: Ok so it took forever to get our other taken. I had to get up and find a server to ask to come take our order. Then when our food finally came out, they forgot mine and by the time they brought my food out, the others at my table were already done eating. We were on a schedule so I had to eat and run. Also, I had the pad Thai and it looked gross and it was so bland. Zero flavor. Zero spice. Major failure. The others at my table didn't like their food either. And guess what. It took forever to get the check. I had to get up and go ask for the check. Oh. And the restrooms were out of order. Crappy experience.
author: Scott G.

description: We came here for a team lunch, the food was average... what really upset me was the poor service. We had two orders of the fried chicken - even after multiple reminders (the server kept saying "It's coming soon"), the fried chicken didn't arrive until a while after the rest of the team had already finished their food (including dessert!). What's odd too is that it seemed like the server really believed that the food was coming soon every time we talked to her...
author: Tak K.

description: It is a decent place with good food at a reasonable price. Much more affordable than Osha thai that is across the street but not as fancy looking. Service is a bit slow though so be prepared to wait anywhere between 30-60 minutes for your food to be ready. It used to be really quiet with not many people but lately it has gotten more crowded. I give the food 5 stars but took 2 away for the slow service. If you are not in a hurry and don't mind a little slow service, I recommend you give it a try.
author: Lasya B.

description:
Came here with a friend yesterday and it was disappointing. Service was decent which is why they're even getting 2 stars. 

Pad thai was WAY too sweet and no spice at all despite asking for Thai hot. The shrimp was also burnt. My friend asked for no tofu in her curry but it came with tofu. The PLATE of fried rice we ordered was basically a scoop of rice and veggies. Instead of calling it veggie fried rice they should call it veggies with a small side of rice.
author: Andrea R.

description: Cha-Am is one of our (my husband and I) favorite Thai restaurants. We had our first dinner date at the Berkeley location and was our go to place for Thai food, but now they have closed the Berkeley location. So, when we are in the city and in the area (especially visiting MOMA) we go to Cha-Am. Their dishes are great and the servers are helpful and nice. Always fresh tasting and the flavors are great. I would recommend this restaurant. This location is walking distance from MOMA and Yerba Buena Gardens.
author: Ej B.

description:
Inconstant pricing, crappy service.

I used to eat here 2-3 times per week due to my work's proximity to this location, this will be the last time I ever set foot in there.

I ordered the Crab Fried Rice tonight and it's clearly $12.95 on their menu and Eat24. When I arrive, they charge my credit card $16.33. I asked the waiter why it was so high and showed him the pricing from their website and he said "Oh that's the lunch prices" and walked off.

Don't give them any of your hard earned money, it's way over-priced and for the amount of money you're wasting, not worth it. Pass.
author: Phong N.

description:
The food here is pretty good, matching in quality with the other higher end Thai spots, without the same pricing. Items are not too sweet nor too spicy and doesn't seem to cater to the western palate. The service is friendly and at lunchtime it is never super busy.

Inside is spacious and looked like it was previously a diner. If it was, then they have not change the decor much except for Thai-themed knick-knacks strewn here and there.

Coworkers and I lunch here once a year because service is slow every time. Each visit is different; took 10 minutes before someone came back to take our order, or the food took a long time to come out, or just to get the check - always one of those three events occurring. We'd go back more often if service was quicker from beginning to end of meal, yep.
author: Peter L.

description: I feel the need to share my experience of their wonderful food! I have lived in Thailand and I can say in comparison Cha Am really puts the local flavor into it. My favorite dish is the lemongrass salad, it's very flavorful! if you like spicy they really make the dish spicy for you! And of course the crab fried rice is pretty amazing as well! big chunks of real crab! will be back !!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Stopped here for a quick beer at an event

The place was pretty empty, with basically 3 guys in the entire place. The place is really big with a lot of tables, so the emptiness is kind of weird. The waitress tried to live up the mood by talking to the other guys, but overall the mood was dull, and she kind of forgot my order (I only ordered one singha beer, and somehow she forgot what kind). Just goes to show how dull the place can be

Overall, not a place you'd go back again
author: Henry L.

description: I had the yellow curry here, it was okay. Every other curry but the yellow curry was on the lunch special menu, which I'm fine with. $16 for small portions. There were hardly any people here, but the service was good. Probably won't be back.
author: Tilly D.

description: Seriously delicious duck, moist and juicy, great sticky rice and flavorful som tom with real green papaya, not cabbage.  Service pleasant, and fast.  Definitely will return to this one.
author: Carla S.

description:
You know how you walk by some places and you never see anyone in there, yet they are still open for business for years?  It seems like Cha-Am is that place.  I come to this part of the City to take part in conferences at the Moscone Center, but on each occation I have wondered why no one was in Cha-Am.  

So...fast forward and I don't want to sit in traffic and I am starving.  I stop in and sure enough I am the only person in there.  The service was fast enough to start but she never returned to check in or fill my beverage.  The food was alright, but there was nothing special about it.  The papaya salad was a little on the bland side and the pad kee mao was just alright.  When I was done it took forever to get my check.   The staff just sat at their table on their phones while myself and another guy waited. 

Oh, one more person came in while I was there.  They insisted on sitting him at the table next to mine.  What?  That is like going to the bathroom and having your choice of 10 different stalls, but you insist on the one next to me.  How about a little personal space?  I could hear him chew.  

What did I learn?  You have to trust your gut, literally!
author: Ryan C.

description: Stingy ass portion! Never going back there ever again. I specifically ask the guy in the front what size is the large Tom Yom Gung soup and he described to me the big size and feeds 4 people. My ass feeds four people. The soup is so salty, watery, with 6 prawns and bunch of mushrooms.  The place is always empty even during lunch and dinner. I should've kept on walking.
author: Karina T.

description:
This place is around the corner from my office, so I have been quite a few times.

The service has always been good, but I usually get there at 1130 so there are not that many other people yet.

I always get the Pad Gow Pow or what I call Thai basil chicken. It is DELICIOUS. Which is why I don't try other things. The serving is monstrous. 

The imperial rolls with sweet Chile sauce are also yummy!

The two negatives:

- They have a weird rule that you have to be a party of four to sit by the window. Dislike

- The layout was poorly planned and it can feel cramped in some areas and super spacious in others.
author: Melissa H.

description:
Chicken satay - peanut sauce is excellent, but some of the chicken is tough and broke 1 skewer trying to pull off the meat.

Pad Kee Mow - seemed like they used different noodles than most other places and did not have much flavor, other than some extremely spicy parts (I ordered medium heat).

Mango sticky rice - barely any coconut milk taste, rice was extremely dense and compacted. . mango was good

Delivery itself was very quick and accurate order.
author: Katie H.

description: The decor was great, food taste decent. The service was a little meh. Ordered a salid never got it got charged.
author: Ernie E.

description: I'm not sure how I haven't reviewed this place before.  It's right across the street from Osha but I actually prefer it over Osha.  The main reason is because when I ask for my green curry to be spicy, they actually make it spicy.  Also the prices are a little less than Osha.  It's a quick and easy lunch.  Sometimes it can get really busy in here during lunch but it has been rare that I can't find a table. I love the green chicken curry and a co-worker of mine really likes their crab fried rice.
author: Amanda K.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday afternoon for lunch. Place was full!

I was told this is the better tasting/more affordable version of Osha.... 

There food took awhile to come out but once we received it it was totally yummy! We had a chicken and a noodle dish. Excellent. 

I think they need to update the decor a little bit. it definitely seems a little dated/80's. Knocking a star for slowish service but price and food were worth returning for! Plus is is less than a lock from my office!
author: Erica D.

description: I ordered Tom Yum Gung soup for $5.75 and Beef Pad Ga Pao, spicy chili and garlic sauce. The taste of meal was good, right amount of spices. However the reason for 3 stars is their policy of not refilling soda and charging extra for rice. The quality of service was good though.
author: Lee H.

description: This is a decent place which is not usually crowded, good for dinner and serving staff are courteous with free on the sides. Overall satisfied with my limited veg menu options
author: Bhaskara C.

description:
Delicious, reasonably priced and good portions. Ordered take-out here - pad see ew and chicken potstickers and they were very fast. 

The potstickers were bomb. They are breaded, so different than how other places prepare them, and it made them crispy and soooo good. Would definitely get those again. 

The pad see ew beef was also really good. This is my favorite Thai noodle dish and they got it right. They also added bean sprouts and onions for me without an extra charge. Next time I will ask for extra broccoli. 

Seating is ample (great for big groups) and the staff is very sweet. Less pricey than Osha across the street with faster service. I will be back again and I would recommend this to anyone craving Thai in the area!
author: Mai N.

description:
I've been here twice and the I'd give this place a solid 4 stars, so I was surprised to see how many people gave it 3 stars or less. However, everyone has a different experience, and 2 visits is a drop of water in a swimming pool of foodies.

We had the basil chicken and curry. The chicken was cooked perfectly and had a fresh, traditionally Thai taste. I usually don't get the curry, but it was quite good. There were only 3 other people there while we were there, which is probably why the food came out so fast. It's definitely worth visiting again to see what other good foods are available.
author: Charles A.

description: Outstanding food outstanding. The service is always good the food is always hot have been coming here for years
author: Regina M.

description: Tried this place first time as the picture was looking good but the food seems to be 2-3 days old in taste .will never come again
author: Teresa B.

description: Nice quiet clean restaurant, good food, good service and very reasonably priced.  It also has a full bar.
author: T. B.

description:
Cha-Am is a great choice if you have a huge group you are accommodating for. However, the service is extremely slow and it will take you at least half an hour to receive your bill and to get it paid. 
My go-to dish is the pumpkin chicken curry but the portion for this meal is a lot smaller compared to the other entrees. If you want more bang for your buck, go with the pad-see-ew. The food is reliable in the sense that you get what you ordered but nothing extraordinary.
author: Grace L.

description: I've actually been here once before and thought it was so so, but I ended upcoming by today for lunch and in glad I did! I ended up ordering one of their special items which was Thai fried rice with crispy chicken. I also ordered a Thai coffee. The food was delicious! The chicken was nice and fresh and worked will with the dipping sauce it came with. The rice was also greet too and didn't taste greasy at all. My only gripe was that it is a bit pricey of course (but it's the city this is about the norm) and I wish for the price it came with a few more pieces of chicken. All in all great service here and good food I'll make sure to come back.
author: James R.

description: The green curry was fabulous and it had a lot of vegetables. The mango shrimp salad was really really yummy as well as the peanut sauce dish.
author: Michelle R.

description:
This place is right downstairs from where we were staying. I was in a hurry and needed dinner for my daughter. I called and ordered a pad see ew chicken, and picked it up in 10 minutes. That was good. It's quick and convenient when you need to feed a hangry 2.5 year old.

The food itself is fine, nothing special. My daughter ate a good amount and that is all that matters. The leftovers were breakfast for the adults the next morning. 

Since I live in LA, I'm not yet accustomed to paying for a plastic bag that I didn't ask for when they packed up my to go order. What is up with that? Can I just ask to not take a bag?
author: Betty Y.

description:
I work on the same block and it's so convenient to come here.  But the service is subpar and the portions are very small. The food is decent, not the best and not the worst, but not worth that wait and bad service. 

I've had pad Thai and green curry here in the past and it's pretty alright. The pad see ew has very small potions. Do consider calling in to order before picking up or you'll end up waiting 20-30 mins.
author: Julia P.

description:
Used Yelp eat24 to order food to deliver, estimated delivery time was an hour but food arrived 15mins late. Was quite disappointed on the delivery time.

However, food was good and tasty. We ordered crab fried rice and Tom Yum Gung. Both dishes are amazing. Will order from Cha-Am Thai again.
author: Brenda W.

description:
Not sure why its always empty.  Large place but always empty.  Not sure how they pay their rent.   Maybe they have more business lunch times and deliveries.
They have a full bar and sexy Thai bartender that can keep you company.   Tanya is great.
Food is A-OK as indicated.
author: Alex R.

description:
We just ordered from this place for the first time and it will likely be the last. We had Tom-Ka-Gai , and Sauteed Pad-King-Sod. 

The soup was tasty but we were quite shocked when we opened the Pad King Sod to find the box not even filled up a third. There was not even enough food for one person. It was like half the order was not put in the box. Very strange. For a 10 dollar entree i would expect at least a cup of food. 

When we talked to them about it, they refused to do anything about our displeasure. They insisted that was the amount of food that 10 dollars buys. I will not be going there ever again.
author: Carmella L.

description:
Fair group lunch place. Food is very standard and taste is ok. Service is so so. I was asking them for hot water, they forgot. After 20min, I asked them again, then they realized.

Big room and comfortable dining experience. For food, they are fair
author: Nina H.

description: Worst service ever! I called in for a pickup order, no answer. I work right upstairs and thought I could walk in to order. After being ignored for a few minutes, I was turned away from ordering! The hostess told me they can't help me because they have a full house and my meal would be over 40 minutes or more to get ready. However, only 3/4 of the restaurant was full. I cannot recommend this spot at all!
author: Stephanie N.

description:
Do yourself a favor and go next door .
Ordered vegetarian food and all food  tasted like it wast 2-3 days old and just reheated . Smelled it so bad . Never coming again.
author: Anushree A.

description:
Fantastic place. I was reading the reviews and thought it would be just an OK meal, the five dishes we ordered were so delicious we brought home left overs, (Something we never do).

Pad Thai, Beef Pa do poh, Pineapple fried rice,  pumpkin curry, all great
author: Mike S.

description:
The lowdown on our DELIVERY EXPERIENCE (09/24/14)
- ordered via Grubhub app

- grubbed on: green chicken curry, chicken pad Thai, BBQ beef ribs, and sticky rice with mango for dessert

- the good: came on time, food was fresh and still nice and hot; portions were perfect for me and my big man; price point was reasonable: $50 after 4 dishes, tip, and taxes (delivery fee is waived after reaching $20 minimum for delivery)

- the bad: if there was a way to make delivery faster then I suppose that would be the only con here, delivery took 70 mins. We ordered at 7 and got it at 810, level of hunger was a 3/5 so we didn't mind the wait.
author: Jenica C.

description:
racist ass hell!!!!! if your black they ignore you won't seay you won't come take your order just walk past you literally!!!! 5 or 6 times like you don't exist i had to get up and go get my own menu then walk over to the waitress minutes later to ask if she was going to come take my order. then she ask what did i want to order... like really u can't come to my table to take it.

then she send someone else to take it.

but soon i white guy come in the door she runs over and had him menu and ask what he wants to drink and some thing with a asian family who literally sat right next to me 

she had there menus before they even sat down but ignored the shit out of me 

still while she service ever table around me

and i'm seated right in the walkway of 6 other people / tables
author: Ron H.

description: Not that great Thai food. Pad-see-ew and pad-Thai are super sweet. The Neua-nam-tok (beef Salad $8.50) has a super weird taste. Too sour and sweet at the same time. I wouldn't ever go back again. The only "ok" dish is the pineapple fried rice
author: Esther Y.

description:
Hit or miss. Cheaper than osha thai, they don't have as fancy of a vibe or drinks there....They sometimes have an awful wait time to get food and for a group it takes forever. Once you get your food you will be happy but playing the over/under waiting game sucks. The bathroom is also a million miles away down a hall it seems.
They do have good specials that come with papaya salad, sticky rice, etc....their dishes in general like the duck curry is good and the spicy veggies.
author: Lily P.

description:
Food is a solid Meh.  I ordered the grilled pork chop and it was very tough.  

The reason they get 1 star is because the service is terrible even for take out.  I asked for an itemized receipt (for reimbursement) and the hostess / waitress gave me such attitude and literally threw the receipt at me.  They were not even busy..and now I know why.
author: Angelo A.

description: Ordered shrimp pad kee mow and tom yum gung for delivery. I requested for the pad kee mow to be Thai spicy which usually means it's cooked with Thai fresh chilies. It gives it a unique spicy flavor. Instead, the chef simply dumped many spoonfuls of crushed red peppers which made it inedible. Wish I waited for House of Thai to open to order from them.
author: Lili T.

description:
This place isn't perfect, but the food is pretty good (my favorite's the pumpkin curry, when they serve it) and I don't have trouble getting a table here even when there's a huge conference next door at Moscone. 

The one downside is the service (despite being practically empty sometimes!)-- they're very friendly, but also pretty slow. I feel like I have to be a little pushy/attention-grabby to order, get a box, or the check. 

Food comes out European-style: one or two dishes at a time, as they're ready.

To be fair, I'm usually going with a group of coworkers for lunch, but we're good guests and if they still have plenty of vacant tables I feel service level ought to scale. 

If you're short on time or less patient, just order ahead for pickup. I work a few blocks away so if I call on my way out the door it's typically ready when I arrive.
author: Krista L.

description: Last night we were tired from a long weekend and wanted something quick and easy. We had ordered delivery from Cha-Am before and it was pretty good. We had gotten the basics the first time (chicken sa-tay, papaya salad, and pad-see-ew) and everything was tasty, although certainly not the best Thai we had ever eaten. Last night's order, however, failed to match our previous experience by a long shot. We ordered the golden triangles, papaya salad, pad kee mow, and pak-pak (mixed vegetables in a garlic-herb sauce). The food arrived on time, but the rest of the dining experience went downhill from there. The golden triangles were a hardened mass of potatoes; I honestly could not taste any other ingredients. The papaya salad was good, but the portion was very small. Half of the container was just undressed mixed greens. The pad kee mow was the best item that we ordered; even though I thought there were way too many bell peppers, the beef was well cooked. The mixed vegetable dish was by far the most disappointing. The vegetables looked like the ones you get from the frozen food section at the grocery store, and tasted super bland. The sauce, if you can call it that, was almost clear and had hardly any flavor. We picked at it a bit before totally giving up and throwing it away. We will definitely be more careful the next time we're choosing a Thai restaurant to order from.
author: Regina L.

description:
Flames.

Ordered the Prak-King Chicken, pad-see-ew, basil beef and panang curry.

Prak-king chicken was so tasty and delicious. Had a nice kick to it too. 5/5

Pad-see-ew was good but I had better. Not enough meat and veggies to noodles ratio. 3/5

Basil beef was also tasty and delicious. Sauce had a nice flavor. 5/5

Panang curry was good but again I had better. Little too much coconut cream which diluted the paste/seasoning. 4/5

Rice was separate. The service was great. Drinks were always filled.

All in all, would come back.
author: Jeff H.

description:
Ordered here last night from Eat 24. We got the Pad See Ew,  Papaya Salad, Crab Fried Rice and Pad Baby Corn. 
-Papaya Salad was really good, I liked that they used Prawns and not those weird dried -Shrimp.
- Pad Baby Corn was also tasty with the vegetables still crisp which is hard to do with take out. 
-The Crab Fried Rice was just OK. As fried Rice it was good, but paying extra for the crab wasn't worth it as it didn't add much to the taste and I'm not sure if there was much crab. 
-Pad see Ew, they used just regular broccoli which was still good. I do agree with some of the other comments that the ratio of meat and vegetable to noodles are a bit off.
I ordered mild on everything and it was way too mild, but food still good. Just not the Thai kick you look forward to. Total bill was $50 w.out tip, which seemed high but it is SF. 

Delivery was awesome, one of the fastest I've had, just over 30 mins. I liked that it seemed to be a dad/daughter team, which probably is unrelated to the restaurant but still appreciated it. 

Would order again, but revise on spice level.
author: Diana L.

description:
This is my favorite thai place in SF. I eat out a LOT - when I mean a lot, I spend between $500-$3000 a month on food. However, Chaam is the type of place where you get tremendous value for your dollar, and absolutely DELICIOUS food.

My absolute favorites:
- Tom Yum Soup (You must ask for Thai version or you will get a sweeter version that is not super sour)
- Chicken Pad Thai (Best in San Francisco. I've eaten at Osha and a ton of other thai places but it can't be beat)
- Duck Fried Rice (BEST Thai food ever - all my friends order it all the time)

For around $10-$20, you have yourself a delicious meal. I order from them very frequently and will continue eating their delicious food.
author: Albert K.

description: Cha-Am and Osha are next to each other, but I decided on Cha-Am because they serve Lad Nah, a noodle dish that not too many people are familiar with, but I have fond memories of from childhood. Not bad! The gravy tasted authentic. They did throw all kinds of veggies like bamboo shots in, which I don't mind but isn't typically used. Overall, pleasantly surprised.
author: William V.

description:
Cold food, bad service, ordered green curry they brought out yellow curry. They still charged for side of rice even after making a mistake
Would not come here again
author: Mag M.

description:
Reasonably priced Thai food and very attentive service. Osha nearby has a trendy ambience, but Cha-Am makes me feel like I'm on the set of that Ryan Gosling movie, "Only God Forgives."  Dim, quiet and relaxing.       

Massaman curry was very rich. Thai fried rice was decent. 

I see myself doing a lot of take-out from Cha-Am.
author: Miran C.

description:
A great lunch in SOMA can be hard to come by if you want to take a break from HRD for the day. My girlfriend and I had resolved to Chaat but then suggested we try something new next door at Cha-Am.

I ordered the green curry with chicken and she tried the eggplant with chicken. The curry itself was alright but the chicken was pretty tough. Her eggplant dish was a bit sweet for my taste, but in moderation was ok. Overall, not terribly impressed however.

Service was mediocre at best, and our waitress clearly had the sniffles. The floors are really dirty too. The lunch prices are decent, but overall the whole experience wasn't mind-blowing.

Food: 6/10

Service: 5/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 5/10
author: Joe M.

description: I don't write reviews but this place is the best thai food ive had in the city! I been going for three years. Dont expect amazing service but be rewarded with great thai food the pad see ew is great!
author: Cody M.

description:
Best Pad-See-Ew ever. 

The noodles are the best texture and still hold up even if you leave it for half an hour (it's around the corner from the office so I've occasionally had to stop eating to do work, come back to it... you know how that goes). I always order mine with Chicken and Tofu. The broccoli is fresh and doesn't have the texture of an overheated, limp vegetable - it's steamed fresh and green. 

It's a bit expensive but at least you get a generous portion. I'd still rather go here than overpriced ass Osha across the street.
author: Aivy C.

description:
We stumbled upon this place when we were visiting the Creativity Museum at the Yerba Buena gardens (Moscone Center). Based on the reviews we were not expecting something spectacular.

But we were blown away by the flavors. We came on a sat afternoon at 2pm, so no lunch
rush. Food took its usual 10 mins to arrive.

We ordered massaman curry with chicken- bold,pungent flavors and quite spicy (we ordered it that way). Also had the red curry with shrimp, more on the sweeter side but flavors were excellent. Both curries came with rice ( it was a little too al dente for my liking as I like my rice to be soft).

Also had the pad see eww with chicken, which was average.

Overall we were happy to have stopped here and would love to get back if we are in the area.
author: nanu b.

description: Ordered cha-am from postmates and was really disappointed by what we receieved. The pad see ew was literally just plain noodles with tofu and veggie. No sauce. The green curry was a mix of water and oil. No flavor with a think layer of oil on top.  Would not recommend again
author: Payal M.

description: The spicy tofu entree is delicious! So many flavors and variety of vegetables. The tofu was firm just the way it was described on the menu. I'm so impressed with this spicy blend, I will return in the near future and recommend others to give it a try!
author: Makeda A.

description: Cha-am isn't super fancy, but I think they have very tasty food for a good price. I particularly like their curries: the red curry and the green curry are my favorite.
author: Adam F.

description: Went there after many many years last weekend. Sadly the food was not as sparklingly delicious as I remembered it to be. Water thin green and yellow curries were the lowlights. The satay and sweet and sour fish were passable. The Pad Thai not so much. Only the vegetarian spring  roll was still on the money - the last standing reminder of past glories.
author: Umair K.

description: Every time I've come here, my food is always fresh, hot, they hook up the meat portion, veggie portion, noodle/rice portion...love this place. My go-to. OH and their Thai ice tea
author: Ryan A.

description: Been here many times and the food has been pretty good but lately the service has been terrible.  Our party waited 40 for food and mine did not come out until 15 min after that.  What they served me was raw vegetables thrown into red curry sauce. They gave me the wrong rice.  The cauliflower had the little black edges like it was too old.  I sent it back and missed lunch altogether.  Serious staffing issues here.
author: Cheryl H.

description:
Pad-See-Ew ($8.95): ok, i do agree with the other reviewers, the pad see ew was good. Noodles does look mushy and the portion is a on the small side for the price you pay. http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/bkgSdQ8TW9ZjFOZ2-nCddQ/l.jpg


Pad-Ga-Pow (8.50): this dish was ok, fresh and was better priced that pad see ew. http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/GICFtmNZcgeSe4-RDjQrpg/l.jpg

Service sucked! Sat down and the lady gave us a huge white board that told us the daily specials... uhh TACKY! 

My coworker and I then waited a good 30 mins and noticed that people that came after us received their order. So we asked the waitress what was going on. Apparently they forgot to put in our order and it took extra long!! It would have been nice if they apologized for forgetting!

Afterwards, we received this to sign our credit card slip. WOW. Just WOW. http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/6Gq4ff8dolGrkMaGL9HKMQ/l.jpg
author: Erica T.

description: Yesterday, I had lunch here with 3 of my co-workers.  The food was bleh and service was horrendous!  We asked to split the bill, and the waiter (an older man) didn't understand the concept.  When we attempted to explain it, he got frustrated, waived his arms in exasperation and walked away angry.  NEVER EVER coming back to this place again.
author: Khristine A.

description:
Summary: Delivery took 2 1/2 hours despite the fact that we're less than a mile from the restaurant. The food arrived cold and failed to match what we ordered.

We were craving Thai food. We found Cha-Am on GrubHub and ordered Pad Thai, Brown Rice, Pot Stickers, and Green Curry with no eggplant. We placed the order just before 6:40 p.m. and received an estimated delivery time of 7:30 p.m. About a half hour later, the estimate was revised to 8:05 p.m. Around 8:20 p.m. we contacted GrubHub, whose customer service told us that the restaurant assured the delivery would arrive soon. The food arrived just after 9:00 p.m. and was cold... and the curry was packed with eggplant. 

GrubHub apologized with a $5 coupon, which we will not be using at Cha-Am.
author: Eric H.

description: Just moved to the area and have not tried this place before. This review is for the customer service, specifically for the person who answers the phone. We ordered some food through grubHub, we chose this place despite that the price was the highest  due to the shortest wait time 30-40 minutes. When the confirmation e-mail came in the wait time was 70 minutes - that is almost double the time! We called the restaurant 5 minutes after receiving the e-mail to inquire what the actual time would be and what is the reason for such a huge difference. The lady on the phone was extremely rude, her explanation was that she does not know why grubHub shows 30 minutes when she always shows 70. As we spent 10 minutes on the phone she kept asking if she should cancel the order - as it turned out 15 minutes after e-mail confirmation, the order still has not been sent to the kitchen! What a waste!
author: Ola S.

description: Got the green curry with prawns and it was really yummy but the shrimp was over cooked. Only 2 pieces of eggplant, and I wish it had more of a variety of the vegetables. Overall tasty but the fact that I had to pay extra to get over cooked tasteless shrimp is upsetting. Especially when they weren't busy at all.
author: Tasha B.

description:
Met up with a friend for a lunch at Cha-Am last week, and we had a solid, filling, and affordable lunch. Don't take the 3 stars to mean I didn't like it; I think I'm just getting apathetic when it comes to Thai food.

My friend ordered the papaya salad ($9.25), which was fairly large for an appetizer, but he polished off in a couple of minutes (he used to be in the military; I think they're taught to eat fast). I had the spicy tofu ($9.50), which was pretty delicious and filling.

The service was great until the restaurant started filling with convention center traffic and a 20-person startup company at one big table. But in general, service was decent, and I'd recommend Cha-Am as a decent place for a filling lunch during the workday.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This place is great, but on the pricier side for a standard Thai restaurant.

Sauteed Pad Himlai ($9.95)
Red Curry ($9.95)

Have to pay $1.75 extra for rice =[ The portions were filling, but looked smaller.

Spacious, good service. I like how they have round booths. Good for big groups.
author: An Y.

description:
This place has pretty friendly staff and good food.   The Pad Prik and Pad Kee Mow are especially tasty.  This place must do most of their business in delivery since the restaurant is usually pretty empty.

I like the casual atmosphere of this place and will definitely return for some of their other special menu items.
author: Andrew V.

description: Pick up your phone!!!!! And people wonder why restaurants like this look so desolate... smh
author: Luie P.

description:
Drove to the city to visit a coworker, and wanted to have lunch at a different restaurant, but it was 3pm by the time we decided to eat, and most restaurants were closed for their lunch-to-dinner transition break. Walked by Cha-Am, saw that it was Zagat-rated, and walked in. 

I wanted to try their Pad Thai (yeah, I would order that...), or have a noodle dish of some sort, but they were only serving lunch menu items, and none of the noodle dishes were listed on the lunch menu, so I settled for their spicy prawn dish: Pad Gung. Prawns, you say? Nope, didn't get prawns. What appeared on my plate instead were small pieces of shrimp, more than enough bamboo shoots, and sliced vegetables smothered in a salty chili sauce and served with rice. The dish did the deed of filling me up, but I've had better Thai food elsewhere.
author: Valerie L.

description:
I quite enjoyed my meal here. The Thai food experience has slowly grown on me after some less than stellar early experiences. I can now add Cha-Am to the list of exceptional Thai eateries that have completely changed my opinion of the cuisine.

I enjoyed a savory chicken dish filled with sweet bubbling sauces, fresh vegetables and hot peppers. The chicken disappeared quickly, but I didn't stop there. I use the fluffy white rice to soak up all the remaining juices and then stopped myself short of picking up the plate and licking it clean.

An added bonus: the restaurant is conveniently located near the city center and a block away from the elegant W Hotel. And they had the Giants game on the tube above the bar for those of us who weren't fortunate enough to be their in person!
author: Alex L.

description: The delivery guy from grubhub is a total joke. Food is way too overpriced and he wants more tips. Beside the restaurant, there is a Chaat indian restaurant. What a joke. Grow a brain to think creative!
author: Alvin Z.

description:
This restaurant is dangerous!

The first time I ordered Stir fried Chicken with cashew nuts- I got stir fried tofu instead. Not a big deal.

It gets worse!

My husband ordered a Beef Curry, being careful to check the ingredient list and not to order anything with eggplant, as I am allergic. The dish arrived, it had 50% of the beef substituted with eggplant. Luckily we noticed in the dark room, otherwise I would have ended up in Emergency ward!

Do not trust these people!
author: Margot G.

description:
I've eaten here a few times as its close to a few of my many work locations, but i probably will take it off my list.
yesterday i only had 45 minutes and i mentioned to the waiter that i was on my lunch break and that i would like to order fairly quickly. He glanced around the room panic stricken and told me he "would do his best". i glanced around the room too: aside from a group of about 7 or 8 there were about 8 other people total in the restaurant. DId i mention this was between noon and 1? I said gently "thats ok, i'm merely letting you know".
Shortly afterwards a different person brought water and i told her i was ready to order. A third person appeared and took my order. I ordered the "Shrimp and asparagus" and asked if it was served with rice "yes".

The dish arrived: it was fairly small (bar the heap of white rice). Upon further inspection i realised it consisted mainly of mixed vegetables: Some asparagus (as advertised), along with snow peas, carrot, green pepper and zucchini and onion. The asparagus was about a 5th of the vegetable mix.

There were 3 shrimp.

i summoned one of the staff over and said "This dish was described as shrimp and asparagus, but there are only 3 shrimp" ...silence...i tried again "normally when a dish is described as "shrimp and asparagus" they are the main or only 2 ingredients. There are only 3 shrimp" 
She went to ask the kitchen and came back almost immediately. her response:

"they are jumbo shrimp"

Did i mention this lunch-sized dish was $12, $13 with tax?
author: tigipop ..

description:
Ordered delivery the other day from them. Was tired of my local Osha Thai.

They delivered 30 min early, and the food was great! My boyfriend and I ordered 2 soups, I can't remember what he got but I had the Tom Kha Gai which I thought was good. We also had the pot stickers, which were weird since they were breaded but I still liked them. And the Thai Imperial Rolls which had awesome sauce!

Would definitely order again. We were so pleased with the food quality and fast service.
author: Cydney S.

description:
Good price for amount of food. Tasty and westernized.  If you look for authenticity, you might have to skip this place. 

I am from midwest so this is remind me how Thai food there is: Juicy kapow and pad pik with no chilli (pik=chilli). Those should be belong to Chinese food.

I give 4 stars because of price only. It is edible but far from real Thai food.(closer than the restaurant across the street though).
author: Asak B.

description:
Came in for lunch with the coworkers after nope-ing out of Osha. We were sat in a corner table at the back of the restaurant, which was already a bad sign.

But I did not want to let that cloud my judgment! I was hungry, and perhaps they wanted to reserve their bigger tables in the middle for larger parties. Or so I thought, until they sat more and more people there while we remained pretty much ignored in the corner. I can definitely say that I have never had to flag down a waiter so many times just to get some basics done. However, it's much cheaper than Osha, so eh.

I got the Pad-Ma-Kuar with chicken after I was finally able to catch the attention of a waitress. It arrived relatively quickly, but there was barely any chicken. Uh. Okay. It tasted all right, but to be fair, I was also famished. I finished my plate feeling overall unsatisfied with what I got, but at least I was full.

Another way-too-long time later we got the bill. Overall, one of the least memorable places in terms of taste and their non-existent service. Nope'ing out of this one next time, too. It would've been a 1 star, but their food was decent for the price and not terrible.
author: Robbin A.

description:
I've had better experiences with Thai restaurants. In San Francisco, it seems like there are at least 3 Thai restaurants in each neighborhood.

When we sat down, we noticed that some of the plates were dirty, so we asked for new ones. When they were bringing out our appetizer plates, these were dirty too! Then they brought us a new batch, and you guessed it... Dirty again.

Aside from the questionable dining materials, the food was good (not great, but good). Although the Pad See Ew was phenomenal; very peppery and full of flavor.

I would rate this 3-4 stars for food and ambiance, but dirty dishware is a killer for me. Makes me wonder about the cleanliness of the plates that already have food on top of it.
author: Eric C.

description: Truly terrible. The food was undercooked and stale, and the ambiance of the restaurant kind of depressing.
author: L. Y.

description:
ok soup and noodles
Was feeling a little under the weather so was craving some hot and spicy soup.  The boy picked up some Tom-ka-j for me and some pad-see-ew for him. Overall both dishes were solid.  The soup was nice and spicy exactly what I liked and the noodles were also to my liking.  Would go back in a bind.
author: Sheetal P.

description:
I've been to Cha-Am several times, and the food is usually ok, and the service is usually poor. 

I've come in with a large group (about 15 people) several times, and each time, we're treated as an inconvenience. I get it--large groups are tough to deal with, but our orders are simple enough and we're polite. 

Today, we had a couple of orders that were incorrect, and all the food took about an hour to come out. The biggest issue was that our servers were rude to us, and I won't be taking my team here again. 

The good: good Thai iced tea.
The bad: the service.
author: Amanda B.

description: Good Thai food. I have been coming here for years. I like their pad thai. It is so convenient if you are at the Moscone Convention Center, it is right across the street! It is a little bit more pricey than some of the other fly-by-night Thai places around the area, but it has always remained great. I always see the owner running around making sure everyone is happy. I am never disappointed there.
author: Peter K.

description:
Considering that I'm a lazy, cheap slob that lives next to this establishment, I've come here many times, different days of the week. 

Tip:
Ask for the spicy pad-see-ew with pork before 7pm (preferably over the weekday). That way, they give you the max. quantity cooked to perfection. DELICIOUS. Otherwise, you'll be robbed, hungry and flipping mthrfkin tables.
author: Dora C.

description:
Cha-Am is hands-down one of the the best Thai restaurant I've ever been to, which is a pretty huge statement, but 100% true. I'm staying at the W Hotel this week and this spot is right across the street, so a few of us wandered in on Sunday night not really knowing what to expect. I think we were thrown off a little because it was pretty empty, and well... extremely quiet. Even though a little bit of music was quietly playing in the background, I'm pretty sure you could've heard a pin drop in the place. That's probably the only thing I would change, because...

The. Food. Is. Awesome. 

I ordered the Gaeng-Ka-Ri, with with spicy homemade yellow curry coconut milk sauce, yellow potatoes, and yellow onions, with a side of brown rice. This dish was too good to stop eating, and the flavors were just explosive. (Potatoes and yellow curry? I can't wait to order this again...)

Our server was adorable and when I asked her to make me any kind of cocktail she wanted (I saw they had a full bar) she looked a little confused. When she came back, she hilariously expressed to me that "she doesn't drink very much, because it makes her a little... drunk." Yes, that is the idea! She asked if I wanted a Long Island iced tea and I agreed, and she brought me back the strongest Long Island I've ever encountered. I know why she gets drunk off a cocktail now, for sure! 

Heading back tonight I'm pretty sure, and I'm going to try to re-create the entire visit because it was that good. Five stars!
author: Aimee K.

description:
Rough...They were severely understaffed during lunch with a packed house so we got our food slightly before the 1 hour mark from when we sat down.  The food was decent but not cooked well or very fresh tasting.

I wouldn't recommend it especially if you're in a hurry and don't order Iced Tea unless you want Chai Tea.
author: Travis H.

description:
Ordered delivery on a Thursday night.  Quality of food was miserable.  Salad was excessively soggy with too much garlic.  The noodles in the pad-see-ew had been sitting too long, and were excessively beat up from a day of being tossed around a heating plate.  The soup was excessively oily, with chicken excessively dry.  Excess in every way, except for goodness.

I composted the leftovers.  2 stars for timely delivery.
author: Charles P.

description:
Despite the hotel-restaurant look and feel, Cha-Am actually serves up some decent Thai. On the recommendation of two friends, I arranged a group dinner at the place. I'm sure everyone had the same dubious feelings upon first sight, but in the end, everyone walked away full and happy. 

We started with some dumplings and chicken skewers for the table. The dumplings were fried golden and delicious, but the chicken skewers had a light curry flavor, peanut sauce for dipping and a cucumber and red onion salad that couldn't be beat. 

For my main course, a chicken dish with cashews and veggies. My request for brown rice was accommodated, and I reveled in the slightly spicy meal. In fact, I ate almost every bite on the plate. 

Cha-Am isn't a destination restaurant, but it is a great place to get a delicious, inexpensive meal with friendly service and a little booze on the side.

Pro tip: Go to the bathroom before you go and save yourself the trek through the back hallways of the adjoining hotel.
author: Michelle C.

description:
I'm trying to figure out how to turn the name of this little Thai hideaway into a pun about being charming...but it's early and I'm jetlagged. Cha-arming? Anyway, you get the point. The place is charming. Get off my back.

Almost in a clever contrast to the hyper-trendy Osha across the street where curries are served with a side of club jams, Cha-Am keeps things simple with great food and good service. Every interaction with our Thai server was a bit of a crapshoot as to whether she understood what we meant, but she was sure to end taking out meal orders with: "Now I will read your orders back to you..."

Right?? Totally charming.

The food came out looking far better than I ever would have expected of this place from my first impression. Plus it never hurts when the meal sizes turn out to land in the intimidating category. I switched it up from my regular Thai choices to go with something I hadn't seen before. I can't remember what it was listed as under the vegetarian section, but it was deep-fried tofu in a spicy chili garlic sauce with fresh veggies and herbs. The only regret was that I wasn't hungry enough to finish my plate.

Service was a little slow post-meal (which is funny because it took NO time for the food to come out piping hot) and we had to wait a good while for our bill to get picked up, but that's definitely not enough of a reason to keep yourself from experiencing this little gem.
author: Ben B.

description: Very tasty! I've recently gotten addicted to the Spicy Tofu. It's really fast and easy to get take-out at lunch - if you manage to beat the crowd that appears at noon.
author: Brian R.

description:
This is a 3.5 star review.

After some not-so-satisfying Thai food in Palo Alto, decided to try Cha-Am since we were nearby. Their food is flavorful! And very spicy!

Had the Po Piah, which is the Thai imperial roll. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5ZIFE2VvL8iH3apK-eNI6w?select=qL6mNSIgj-Nqo-vbq3H4-w) Generous plate of rolls. Very tasty! Similar to the Vietnamese imperial roll. But this was served with an intereresting sweet chili peanut sauce.

I ordered the Pa Neang Neua Curry, which I thought is panang curry. So it didn't cross my mind that I needed to ask for mild heat.(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5ZIFE2VvL8iH3apK-eNI6w?select=LhnsDjjZ-WdEvE3kC7EsxQ) Well it looked like panang curry, but ever-so-spicy! Served with super tender flank steak. It was good but the spiciness was overwhelming!

Also had the Ga Pao Tofu. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5ZIFE2VvL8iH3apK-eNI6w?select=hPkDRoNUGPaeikyaokF7GQ) Good flavors but super spicy also.

This place is perfect for those who enjoy super spicy foods. As for me, I eventually gave up trying to eat the food, and filled up on rice and iced water.
author: Marti L.

description: We ordered before all the tables around us and they all got our food before us. We had an hour to eat in between meetings and we thought ordered right when we sat down would ensure we wouldn't be late. However, one hour later still no food. We asked for the check and they put the food we never got on the bill. We had to ask for them to take it off. The waitress may have been new so maybe that's the reason. Needless to say I'm not going back.
author: Sanam A.

description:
Decided to stay in tonight and order a delivery.
Cha-Am was a great choice by my girlfriend. 
She got for us: 
Green Curry with Chicken - a little spicy for her but I loved it. She mixed it right away with the rice in a bowl and it was great. 
Pad Thai with chicken - wow noodles were great. 
BBQ Ribs - hit the spot - perfectly cooked almost melt in your mouth. 
Sweet Sticky Rice - personally I am not a fan of sweet rice but this was actually good with the mango. 

The food came in hot but it did take an hour and 10 minuets to get here from the moment we ordered and we are 0.7 miles from the place. 
So as a quick suggestion when you order delivery do it an hour before you are planing to eat.
author: Shachar Y.

description: I really love the staff here. They're all very nice. The only thing they could do better is answer the phone because its really hard to get a hold of someone to place a to go order, but other than that I love this place! they have the best Thai iced tea, and they have really good lunch specials.
author: Monique C.

description: Food is mediocre and service is poor. Don't order Martinis. The chicken wings are delish.
author: Brittney D.

description:
My family has had all our large celebrations here for years.   Last night my family celebrated Poppy's 70th birthday.

It's equally enjoyable for the guy who complains if the soup is lukewarm, the kids who won't eat anything spicy, my sister-in-law who loves it really HOT and spicy, the hipsters who want trendy food and a full bar, visitors who have never tried Thai food, world travelers who want it authentic and me wanting fresh food with fabulous flavor.   

We appreciate that it's locally owned and run by an immigrant family building their own American dream thru hard work - they go the extra mile to ensure happy customers.  Hint: People in other countries traditionally linger over their food.  The staff here typically gives time to enjoy your food, but if your idea of great service is to have the plates cleared away then just ask.  

If you work in the area, they DELIVER ...
author: Dawn T.

description:
The beef in the pumpkin red curry was very chewy. So was the pork in the pad Thai, which was sweet but not salted enough. This is too bad because they used to have some really great, very tasty pad Thai. Too bad to see they are going downhill. The one in Berkeley was especially good before but is gone now.

OSHA next door seems to be taking all of their business, though that's more for those who prefer trendy decor.

For the best Thai in the city try Marnee or Les Ros!
author: Dennis W.

description: Had 5 dishes here.  All excellent.  Pad Thai, corn cakes,  Tom Ka gia soup yellow curry, and Thai fried chicken.  Yum!
author: Laurie R.

description:
I remember Cha-Am used to be the go to place for Thai. Now with many other choices, I guess it has fallen down the pecking order. 

The place has a nice vibe to it. Really roomy and comfortable. Virtually empty tonight as I went in; total of three tables including mine. Yet service was not good. Too examples: 1) I waited a long time to order even with so few tables. 2) when my order came I asked for bowls, the waiter didn't came right back and my wife told me that he went to give something to another table before he came to ours. That is poor service. Even if the other table asked for something, I asked first so you should have brought what I asked for first. To me, that is bad service.

Food was average at best. We ordered the chicken satay. It was ok. The chicken was tender enough but the spice was not to my liking. But my son liked it so I'm happy about that.

I ordered the Shrimp fried rice and th Pad see ew noodles. The fried rice was tasty but a little greasy. It also had a peppery aftertaste that is still in the back of my throat as I write this (2 hours later). The Pad see ew is on their lunch menu but not their dinner menu? How weird is that? So I guess the portion size that came was the lunch portion? That was my only rational for a size that was literally so small I was shocked when I saw it. I contemplated asking the waiter but decided against it. So how small was it? It was about four tablespoons worth. That was it. I literally served a portion to my wife, a spoonful to my son, and what was left was a few strands of noodles left. Wow. I guess it's just enough for me to try it, huh? Anyway it too had a peppery aftertaste. I didn't like it at all.

My wife did like the Thai Ice tea. She said it was one of the best she's tasted in a while. I'm glad that turned out good.

Not really desirous of coming back here.  I guess I'm try Osha across the street next time.
author: Dom L.

description:
This was very good Thai food.

1,  The is a review of delivery from Cha-Am Thai.

2.  Ordering is easy via Grubhub.com.

3.  Chicken Satay - The chicken was tender.  The peanut sauce was good.  This was pretty good satay.

http://tinyurl.com/3j7pr8y

4.  Pad-Prik Chicken - This is a sauteed chicken dish with string beans and bell peppers.  The chicken was tender.  The vegetables were fresh and crisp.  There was a very nice mix of sweet and heat.  This was a very good Thai dish.

http://tinyurl.com/3cmg3q8

5.  Pad Thai Prawns - My brother ordered the Pad Thai. I did not try it.  He enjoyed it.

http://tinyurl.com/3ge34c6

http://tinyurl.com/44vhq7y

6.  Jasmine Rice - The rice was a little dry and clumpy.  But, once you mixed it up some, it was ok,

7.  The food was neatly packed in easy to reseal boxes.

8.  Relatively high order minimum ($20) for delivery.  Delivery was free.

9.  The prices were a little high compared to other Thai delivery options.

2  Steamed Jasmine Rice  $ 3.00
1  Pad Thai  $ 8.95
2  Canned Soda  $ 4.00
1  Pad-Prik  $ 9.75
1  Sa-Tay  $ 7.50
Subtotal  $33.20
Tax  $3.15
Total  $36.35

10.  Delivery was fast.  The order was submitted at 7:01 pm.  The order was delivered at 7:26 pm.  Less than 30 minutes is pretty much blazing fast.  The delivery person was professional and polite.
author: Mark D.

description:
This is not the best thai in the City.

But! They care.

I've eaten here when there is no one else there, and they check up on you, making sure you get the right stuff.

When I order online, they call my cell and confirm things that seem suspicious to them, and it really gives me confidence when I order that I'll get what I want.. Things like: Did you forget to add rice? You said spicy on everything but the last, do you want it spicy as well?

Also - I like their seitan creations! Vegetarians should eat here!
author: Jeff M.

description:
Had delivery from here last weekend. While we were quoted 30-45 minutes, it took more than 1 hour.

Nothing tasted that fresh or delicious. We had shrimp cakes as an appetizer, pad thai, coconut soup and a beef dish which had been marked a popular item on Seamless. I felt gross and unfulfilled afterwards.

Also, there was a hair in my food. :(
author: Daniel P.

description:
USE CASH!!

I jumped over here to order take out - Tom-Ka-Gai, Pad Thai, and a Thai tea for $16.20. The soup was okay and had original flavors. I've made it and had better though. The Pad Thai was good and tea fine, too. 

If you're going to come here, pay with cash! I used by credit card and they charged me double! I'm sorry, I'm not going to tip double for take-out when you didn't have to wait on me. Fortunately, my bank rectified the charges for me. Good luck!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
I am a Pad Thai addict. Absolutely my go-to at Thai restaurants. If you're a Thai restaurant and mess up the pad Thai you've gotta be going out of biz soon. 

That said, this place's pad Thai is....  Different. Its not bad, just different. I can't put my finger on what ingredient they added, but I'm thinking it's some kind of fish sauce. The taste is quite strong. Stronger than I'm used to for pad Thai at least. They should try it without the fish sauce and see how it goes over.
author: Michelle V.

description: This place is delicious!  Very underrated and has good flavor for reasonable prices.  We got the beef Panang curry and a mushroom dish and loved it!  Good portions, friendly service-they let us split our bill four ways!  Definitely recommend it!
author: Lisa B.

description:
Came here with a friend and ordered the red curry with beef. Pretty good. Sweet with a kick of spice at the end. Nothing really made it stand out from other red curries that I had at other places unfortunately. Around lunch time, this place is EMPTY. For $10, the serving size is not the biggest but service was good so that balances it out. 

I would recommend the Thai place across the street (OSHA). A bit more expensive I'll admit, but their dishes are much more fancy and you won't feel like you're paying too much.
author: Austin W.

description:
I love Cha-Am. They are one of the few really GOOD yet affordable Thai places within delivery or walking distance of my house, which is a big deal when you're relatively broke and most everything in your 'hood is out of your range (I live one block from AT&T Park). 

Great dishes here include: Pad See Ew, Pad Kee Mao (I just read online that these are also known as "Drunkard's Noodles," meaning that says it ALL about why I apparently gravitated toward this dish, JUST SAYIN), and the crispy tofu appetizer. I'll definitely try different stuff but that's what we've been getting lately. 

One of my favorite things about Cha-Am is that it's really easy to ask for a dish to be made vegan. I know that's typically an easier thing with Thai food than with other cuisines, but I find it even easier at Cha-Am. I don't feel guilty about it, like I'm insulting the chef(s) or ruining the dish. It's nice to have that peace of mind. 

I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because I tend to find that their spiciness rules (mild-medium-hot) are kind of hit or miss. As in, mild sometimes tastes like nothing, and sometimes it's five alarms and 10 glasses of water later I'm whimpering in the corner. I'm not a wimp! I promise! And this will be on the same dish, two different times. All in all though -- this is not a huge deal to me. In fact, it's kinda fun. ;)
author: Amber G.

description:
Such a disappointment. 

We ordered take out that took over 2 hours to arrive, and when it did it was inedible. The food was cold, the chicken in the pad Thai was so overcooked that it was grey, the noodles were so greasy that they slithered down the throat, and there was not the slightest bit of vegetable or sauce to found. 

Seriously?! How are you going to be a Thai restaurant that can't cook pad thai?!

And what's better? We call to complain and they were gracious enough to refund 15% of our meal. 

Go elsewhere. There are far too many fantastic Thai places here in SF for anyone to have to settle for this garbage.
author: Jackie O.

description:
[FOOD]
The food is somewhat mediochre. I've been to many thai restaurants and the food isn't bad at all, it's just not spectacular. I got Pad See Ew with chicken and the Kai Tom Ka (chicken coconut soup) - the soup was good, but the noodles were just OK. 

I paid $1.50 for a small glass of coke. -_- lol.

[SERVICE]
